title: Old Serif - weird V
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701141004im_/http:/typophile.com/files/v_6247.jpg)

Any font close to this? Any help would be super!

Thanks
author: SF

comments.content:
Angled terminals like your \_V\_ are found in the lowercase of Jenson Oldstyle designed by J. W. Phinney of the Dickinson Type Foundry in 1893,

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701141004im_/http:/typophile.com/files/JensonOSLC_5304.jpg)
 but not in the uppercase. Now available as LTC Jenson [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-jenson/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701141004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-jenson/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-jenson/")  
The terminal style was popular circa 1900 and it was used in the uppercase of some lettering designs. Some digging might turn up a digital font with the \_V\_.  
don
Thank you so much for the help! and info!
